translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about Sakiṁsammajja
The Elder Koraṇḍapuppha’s Birth Story

analyzed: vanakammikaḥ pure āsi  pitu mātu matena aha
translated: “In the past I was a woodcutter,
and I lived by hunting with my father and mother.🔽I had no skill,
and I had no skill.
Near my home
the three-stepped one, the leader of the three worlds,
the one with eyes of compassion,🔽showed me three steps.
Seeing the three steps
of the Teacher named Tissa,
with a mind full of joy,
I had faith in the steps.
Seeing a flowering koraṇḍa tree,
a tree that grows on the ground,
I took a handful of flowers
and worshipped the best of steps.
By that good deed well done,
by my intention and aspiration,
having given up a human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
Wherever I was reborn,🔽as a god or a human,
I was always beautiful,

analyzed: koraṇḍa vaṇṇa koyā iva  su pabhāsaḥ bhavāmaha
translated: like a koraṇḍa flower.
For twenty-two eons,
from the time I did that deed,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the steps.
I have burned up the defilements,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā koraṇḍapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā koraṇḍapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus have I heard: this was said by the Elder Koraṇḍapupphiya.
The Story of the Elder Koraṇḍapupphiya is the fifth.
